N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 502.4 - Disclosure by providers and fiscal agents; information on ownership and control

State Regulations

Each provider and fiscal agent must disclose the
following information: (a) the name
and address of each person with an ownership or control interest in the
disclosing entity or in any subcontractor in which the disclosing entity has
direct or indirect ownership of five percent or more or who is a managing
employee in the disclosing entity; (b) whether any of the persons named in
compliance with section
502.2
of this Part is related to
another as spouse, parent, child or sibling; and
(c) the name of any other disclosing entity
in which a person with an ownership or control interest in the disclosing
entity also has an ownership or control interest. This requirement applies to
the extent that the disclosing entity can obtain this information by requesting
it in writing from the person. The disclosing entity must: (1)
keep copies of all these requests and the
responses to them; (2)
make them
available to the department upon request; and
(3)
advise the department when there is no
response to a request. Notes
